site.name: Chic
site.description: Chic is an alpha AI-first programming language and toolchain.

footer.meta: Chic is an alpha project. Content is sourced from the Chic monorepo docs and may change rapidly.

home.title: Chic is an alpha programming language and toolchain.
home.lede: Chic is designed for tight, structured feedback loops: clear diagnostics, deterministic builds, and workflows that are safe to automate.

quickLinks.installBody: Build the `chic` CLI from source and run your first program.
quickLinks.learnBody: Take a short tour of the language and how projects are structured.
quickLinks.docsBody: Read curated docs from this repo, including the mission and getting-started guide.
quickLinks.blogBody: Updates and roadmap notes as Chic evolves.

home.whyLede: Chic is built around predictable behavior, tooling-first ergonomics, and long-term self-hosting.

whyBullets.aiFirst: AI-first feedback loops: structured outputs and diagnostics designed for automation.
whyBullets.correctness: Correctness by design: clear ownership/borrowing and explicit runtime behavior.
whyBullets.determinism: Determinism: builds and runtime behavior are designed to be predictable and cache-friendly.
whyBullets.selfHosting: Self-hosting: over time, more of the toolchain and standard library moves into Chic itself.

home.buildLede: Explore the ecosystem areas Chic is building toward.

buildTiles.cliBody: Manifests, deterministic builds, and test workflows designed for tight iteration.
buildTiles.wasmBody: WASM backend work in progress, with clear docs on constraints and goals.
buildTiles.embeddedBody: Explicit runtime layers and `no_std` planning to support constrained environments.
buildTiles.toolingBody: Design notes and spec-backed implementation to keep behavior intentional and documented.

home.involvedLede: Chic is developed in the open. Issues and PRs are the primary collaboration path today.

install.title: Install
install.lede: Chic is currently developed from source. These steps build the bootstrap compiler and the chic CLI.
install.alphaNotice: Chic is an alpha project. Expect breaking changes. For the authoritative instructions, see the repo README.md.

learn.title: Learn
learn.lede: Start with the docs that define Chic’s goals, workflow, and language tour.
learn.body: Chic is designed around deterministic workflows and AI-first feedback loops. If you’re new, start with the mission and getting-started docs, then move to the language tour.

tools.title: Tools
tools.lede: Tooling is a core part of Chic: clear diagnostics and automation-friendly workflows.
tools.cliBody: The chic executable is the primary interface today: build, test, run, and project scaffolding.
tools.vscodeBody: The repo contains a VS Code extension under chic-vscode/ (syntax + LSP client).

playground.title: Playground
playground.lede: A web playground is not available yet.
playground.body1: Chic is still in alpha. A public playground will likely arrive later, after the language and runtime surface is more stable and the security model is well defined.
playground.body2: For now, the best way to try Chic is locally via the CLI (see Install).

governance.title: Governance
governance.lede: Chic is currently maintained as an early-stage, alpha project.
governance.body: Governance is expected to evolve as the project grows. Today, the most reliable sources of truth are the repo and its docs/spec.

community.title: Community
community.lede: Chic collaboration currently happens primarily on GitHub.
community.body: Community channels (chat/forums) may be added later; this page will link them once they exist.

blog.title: Blog
blog.lede: Updates and roadmap notes as Chic evolves.

docs.title: Docs
docs.lede: Curated documentation rendered from this repo’s markdown files.
docs.body: This is intentionally a curated subset for v1. Each page links back to its source file in the Chic monorepo.

notFound.title: Page not found
notFound.body: If you expected something here, please open an issue with the broken link and what you were trying to reach.
